derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thrum (only in tungethrum 'ligament of the tongue'): of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dreum 'thrum' and German Trumm 'end piece'. The current sense dates from Middle English

entry.tran: (机器、引擎)嗡嗡响，发出沉闷声
entry.def: When something such as a machine or engine thrums, it makes a low beating sound.
